form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Lee introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide for simplification, to reduce the number of tax brackets, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Family Fairness and Opportunity Tax Reform Act .

section.header: Consolidation of tax brackets and modifications to tax rates

subsection.text: Section 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking subsections (a) through (d) and inserting the following:
There is hereby imposed on the taxable income of every individual a tax determined in accordance with the following table:

row.entry: Not over the first bracket dollar limit
Over the first bracket dollar limit
An amount equal to 15% of the first bracket dollar limit, plus 35% of the excess over such first bracket dollar limit.

subsection.text: For purposes of this section, the first bracket dollar limit is—

paragraph.text: in the case of—

subparagraph.text: a married individual (as defined in section 7703) who makes a single return jointly with the individual's spouse under section 6013, or
a surviving spouse (as defined in section 2(a)),

paragraph.continuation-text: 200 percent of the amount determined under paragraph (2), and

paragraph.text: in the case of any other individual, $87,850.

subsection.header: Inflation adjustment for rates applicable to individuals

paragraph.text: In the case of any taxable year beginning in a calendar year after 2013, the dollar amount in subsection (b)(2) shall be increased by an amount equal to—

subparagraph.text: such dollar amount, multiplied by

the cost-of-living adjustment determined under subsection (f)(3) for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins, by substituting calendar year 2012 for calendar year 1992 in subparagraph (B) thereof.

paragraph.text: If any increase determined under paragraph (1) is not a multiple of $50, such amount shall be rounded to the next lowest multiple of $50.
Clause (i) of section 1(h)(1)(B) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to read as follows:

clause.text: $36,250 (200 percent of such amount in the case of a joint return or a surviving spouse (as defined in section 2(a))), over

paragraph.text: Subclause (I) of section 1(h)(1)(C)(ii) of such Code is amended to read as follows:

subclause.text: $400,000 ($450,000 in the case of a joint return or a surviving spouse (as defined in section 2(a))), over

paragraph.text: Subsection (h) of section 1 of such Code is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

subparagraph.text: In the case of any taxable year beginning in a calendar year after 2013, each of the dollar amounts in subparagraphs (B)(i) and (C)(ii)(I) of paragraph (1) shall be increased by an amount equal to—

clause.text: the cost-of-living adjustment determined under subsection (f)(3) for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins, by substituting calendar year 2012 for calendar year 1992 in subparagraph (B) thereof.

subparagraph.text: If any increase determined under paragraph (1) is not a multiple of $50, such amount shall be rounded to the next lowest multiple of $50.

paragraph.text: Subsection (f) of section 1 of such Code is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking the heading and inserting Inflation adjustments for estates and trusts ,
in paragraph (1), by striking subsections (a), (b), (c), (d), and (e) and inserting subsection (e) ,
in paragraph (2)—

clause.text: by striking subsection (a), (b), (c), (d), and (e), as the case may be, and inserting subsection (e) , and
by striking except as provided in paragraph (8),, and

subparagraph.text: by striking paragraphs (6), (7), and (8) and inserting the following:

paragraph.text: If any increase determined under paragraph (2)(A) is not a multiple of $50, such increase shall be rounded to the next lowest multiple of $50.
Section 1 of such Code is amended by striking subsection (i).
Section 2 of such Code is amended by striking subsection (b).
Paragraph (2) of section 25B(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to read as follows:

In the case of any taxpayer not described in paragraph (1), the applicable percentage shall be determined under paragraph (1) except that such paragraph shall be applied by substituting for each dollar amount therein (as adjusted under paragraph (3)) a dollar amount equal to 50 percent of such dollar amount.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2013.
Subsection (a) of section 55 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new flush sentence:

quoted-block.quoted-block-continuation-text: No tax shall be imposed by this section for any taxable year beginning after December 31, 2013, and the tentative minimum tax of any taxpayer for any such taxable year shall be zero for purposes of this title.

subsection.text: The amendment made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2013.
Section 24 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

paragraph.text: In addition to the amount allowed under subsection (a), there shall be allowed as a credit against tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year with respect to each qualifying child of the taxpayer an amount equal to $2,500.

subparagraph.text: In the case of any taxable year beginning in a calendar year after 2013, the dollar amount in paragraph (1) shall be the greater of the amount in effect under such paragraph for the preceding taxable year or the amount determined under subparagraph (B).

clause.text: Not later than November 1 of 2013, and each subsequent calendar year, the Secretary shall make and publish the determination under this subparagraph for the succeeding calendar year.
The amount determined under this subparagraph for any calendar year is an amount equal to—

subclause.text: the ratio of the national average wage index (as defined in section 209(k)(1) of the Social Security Act) for the calendar year before the calendar year in which the determination under this subparagraph is made to the national average wage index (as so defined) for 2012.

clause.text: If any increase determined under clause (i) is not a multiple of $50, such amount shall be rounded to the next lowest multiple of $50.

subparagraph.text: The aggregate credits allowed to a taxpayer under subpart C shall be increased by the lesser of—

clause.text: the credit which would be allowed under this section without regard to this subsection and the limitation under section 26(a), or

the amount by which the aggregate amount of credits allowed by this subpart (determined without regard to this subsection) would increase if the limitation imposed by section 26(a) were increased by the excess (if any) of—

subclause.text: the taxpayer's social security taxes for the taxable year, over
the credit allowed under section 32 for the taxable year.

clause.continuation-text: The amount of the credit allowed under this paragraph shall not be treated as a credit allowed under this subpart and shall reduce the amount of credit otherwise allowable under paragraph (1) without regard to section 26(a).

subparagraph.text: For purposes of subparagraph (A), the term social security taxes has the meaning given such term under subsection (d)(2), except that—

clause.text: such term shall include the amount of taxes imposed by section 3111 and 3221(a) on amounts paid with respect to such taxpayer during the calendar year in which the taxable year begins, and
in applying clauses (ii) and (iii) of subparagraph (A) thereof, 100 percent shall be substituted for 50 percent each place it appears.

subparagraph.text: For purposes of this title, the amount of any refundable credit allowed by reason of subsection (d) shall be taken into account before the application of this paragraph.

paragraph.text: Subsection (a) of section 24 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking for which the taxpayer is allowed a deduction under section 151 .
Subparagraph (A) of section 24(d)(1) of such Code is amended by striking section and inserting subsection (a) .

subsection.text: The amendment made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2013.

paragraph.text: Subpart A of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by inserting after section 25D the following new section:

subsection.text: In the case of an individual, there shall be allowed a credit against the tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year an amount equal to—

paragraph.text: in the case of an individual who does not file a joint return, $2,000, and
in the case of an individual who files a joint return or a surviving spouse (as defined in section 2(a)), 200 percent of the amount in effect under paragraph (1).

subsection.text: No credit shall be allowed under subsection (a) to any individual who is a qualifying child (as defined in section 24(c)) with respect to whom a credit is allowed under section 24 to another taxpayer for any taxable year beginning in the same calendar year as such taxable year.

paragraph.text: In the case of any taxable year beginning in a calendar year after 2013, the dollar amount under subsection (a)(1) shall be increased by an amount equal to—

subparagraph.text: such dollar amount, multiplied by

the cost-of-living adjustment determined under section 1(f)(3) for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins, by substituting calendar year 2012 for calendar year 1992 in subparagraph (B) thereof.

paragraph.text: If any increase determined under paragraph (1) is not a multiple of $50, such amount shall be rounded to the next lowest multiple of $50.
The table of sections for subpart A of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of such Code is amended by inserting after the item relating to section 25D the following new item:

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2013.

section.header: Repeal of standard deduction, certain personal exemptions, and itemized deductions other than the mortgage interest deduction and charitable contribution deduction

subsection.header: Repeal of standard deduction and itemized deductions

paragraph.text: Section 63 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking subsections (b) through (g) and inserting the following:

subsection.header: Itemized deductions not allowed for individuals

paragraph.text: In the case of an individual, no deduction shall be allowed for any itemized deduction.
For purposes of this subtitle, the term itemized deductions means the deductions allowable under this chapter other than—

subparagraph.text: the deduction for qualified residence interest (as defined in section 163(h)(3)),
the deduction allowed under section 170, and
any other deductions allowable in arriving at adjusted gross income.

paragraph.text: Subsection (a) of section 63 is amended by striking (other than the standard deduction).

subsection.header: Repeal of personal exemptions for taxpayer and spouse
subsection.text: Section 151 of such Code is amended by striking subsection (b).
The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2013.
Clause (ii) of section 163(h)(3)(B) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking $1,000,000 ($500,000 in the case of a married individual filing a separate return and inserting $300,000, and
by striking $1,000,000 in the heading and inserting $300,000.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to indebtedness incurred in taxable years beginning after December 31, 2013.

subsection.header: Repeal of additional hospital insurance tax on high-Income taxpayers

subparagraph.text: Section 3101(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to read as follows:

subsection.text: In addition to the tax imposed by the preceding subsection, there is hereby imposed on the income of every individual a tax equal to 1.45 percent of the wages (as defined in section 3121(a)) received by him with respect to employment (as defined in section 3121(b)).

clause.text: Section 3102 of such Code is amended by striking subsection (f).
Section 6654 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking subsection (m) and by redesignating subsections (n) as subsection (m).

subparagraph.text: Section 1401(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to read as follows:

subsection.text: In addition to the tax imposed by the preceding subsection, there is hereby imposed for each taxable year, on the self-employment income of every individual, a tax equal to 2.90 percent of the amount of the self-employment income for such taxable year.

clause.text: Section 164(f) of such Code is amended by striking (other than the taxes imposed by section 1402(b)(2)).
Section 1402(a)(12)(B) of such Code is amended by striking (determined without regard to the rate imposed under paragraph (2) of section 1401(b)).

paragraph.text: The amendments made by this subsection shall apply with respect to remuneration received, and taxable years beginning after, December 31, 2013.

subsection.header: Repeal of unearned income medicare contribution

paragraph.text: Subtitle A of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking chapter 2A.

subparagraph.text: Section 6654 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

clause.text: in subsection (a), by striking the tax under chapter 2, and the tax under chapter 2A and inserting and the tax imposed under chapter 2 , and

subclause.text: by striking paragraph (3) and redesignating paragraph (4) as paragraph (3), and
by striking plus at the end of paragraph (2) and inserting minus.

subparagraph.text: The table of chapters for subchapter A of chapter 1 of such Code is amended by striking the item relating to chapter 2A.

paragraph.text: The amendments made by this subsection shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2013.

section.text: The Secretary of the Treasury or the Secretary’s delegate shall, not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, submit to the Committee on Ways and Means of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Finance of the Senate a draft of any technical and conforming changes in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 which are necessary to reflect throughout such Code the purposes of the provisions of, and amendments made by, this Act.
